author: u1
title: Welcome Note
content: Welcome to the new workspace! This platform is designed to help you organize your thoughts, collaborate with the team, and manage your daily tasks efficiently. Make sure to check the settings page to customize your profile and notification preferences. We are excited to have you on board as we transition to this new system architecture.

author: u2
title: System Architecture
content: The new backend utilizes a microservices approach. Key components include: 1. Authentication Service (OAuth2), 2. Note Management Engine (Node.js/Express), 3. Search Indexer (Elasticsearch), and 4. Real-time Notification Layer (WebSockets).

author: u3
title: Database Optimization
content: Tips for indexing: Use B-tree for range queries, GIN for JSONB fields, and always analyze query plans.

author: u2
title: API Documentation
content: The simulated API endpoints are now live. You can access /api/notes for a list of all notes and /api/users for user metadata. The authentication header requires a Bearer token. Error handling has been implemented for 404 and 500 status codes, returning structured JSON error objects to help frontend developers debug integration issues effectively.

author: u1
title: Grocery List
content:
1. Organic Milk (2 cartons)
2. Large Brown Eggs (1 dozen)
3. Whole Wheat Bread
4. Fresh Spinach
5. Chicken Breast (2 lbs)

author: u3
title: Statistical Models
content: Applying regression to user activity data to predict future engagement. By analyzing the 'Edited At' timestamps and 'Visibility' flags, we can identify patterns where users tend to make their notes public after several rounds of revision.

author: u3
title: Data Cleansing
content: Removing duplicates from the user table.

author: u1
title: Meeting Minutes
content:
Attendees: currentuser, dev_guru, data_wizard.
- Discussed the JSON schema for dummy data.
- Agreed on 14 initial note entries.
- Set a deadline for the API simulation by Friday.
